headline: Google Offers Remedies to EU After $3.4 Billion Ad Tech Fine
summary: The company put forward proposals to change how its ad tech business works in the EU, but stopped short of offering to sell parts of the business.

headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock to Own for Decades and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.

headline: Cloud AI Update - VAST Data and Google Cloud Expand AI Accessibility
summary: VAST Data has announced an expanded collaboration with Google Cloud to enhance the accessibility of enterprise AI across hybrid cloud environments. This partnership introduces the VAST AI Operating System as a fully managed service on Google Cloud, enabling seamless connectivity between on-premises and cloud environments without the need for complex data migrations. The integration aims to simplify the deployment of AI workloads globally, allowing organizations to operate AI models across...

content.title: Cloud AI Update - VAST Data and Google Cloud Expand AI Accessibility

This partnership introduces the VAST AI Operating System as a fully managed service on Google Cloud, enabling seamless connectivity between on-premises and cloud environments without the need for complex data migrations. The integration aims to simplify the deployment of AI workloads globally, allowing organizations to operate AI models across...

headline: Apple Stock Resists Tech Selloff. There’s Good News on iPhone Sales.
summary: Apple  was slipping early on Friday but was performing better than most of its large technology peers.  The iPhone maker is benefiting from strong sales in China and could be about to unlock a new source of revenue.  Apple shares were down 0.1% in early trading.

content.title: Apple Stock Resists Tech Selloff. There’s Good News on iPhone Sales.
content.summary: Apple  was slipping early on Friday but was performing better than most of its large technology peers.  The iPhone maker is benefiting from strong sales in China and could be about to unlock a new source of revenue.  Apple shares were down 0.1% in early trading.

headline: Does Meta, Google's use of debt to finance AI signal a bubble?
summary: Meta (META), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), and Oracle (ORCL) are among the companies funding artificial intelligence (AI) spending through corporate bond sales. Robinhood chief investment officer Stephanie Guild, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma examine whether the trend signals the existence of an AI bubble. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway bets on Alphabet
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) revealed it has taken a stake in Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL). The position is currently valued at just over $4 billion. The news came on the same day Google announced it was going to spend about $40 billion on AI data centers in Texas. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway reveals $4.3 billion stake in Alphabet, cuts Apple
summary: Investing.com -- Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a $4.3 billion stake in Google’s parent Alphabet, making the company its 10th largest equity holding as of September 30, according to a regulatory filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway reveals $4.3 billion stake in Alphabet, cuts Apple
content.summary: Investing.com -- Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a $4.3 billion stake in Google’s parent Alphabet, making the company its 10th largest equity holding as of September 30, according to a regulatory filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday.

headline: Google to invest $40 billion in Texas data centers through 2027, Bloomberg reports
summary: Investing.com -- Google plans to invest $40 billion to build three new data centers in Texas by 2027, Bloomberg reported Friday, expanding its infrastructure as AI competition intensifies.

content.title: Google to invest $40 billion in Texas data centers through 2027, Bloomberg reports
content.summary: Investing.com -- Google plans to invest $40 billion to build three new data centers in Texas by 2027, Bloomberg reported Friday, expanding its infrastructure as AI competition intensifies.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway Bought Alphabet Shares in the Third Quarter. Here’s What It Sold.
summary: The filing, released on Friday, detailed the firm’s equity holdings of U.S.-listed securities as of Sept. 30.  Alphabet made up 1.6% of Berkshire’s portfolio by the end of September.  In the third quarter, Berkshire sold $10.6 billion worth of  Apple  shares, $1.9 billion worth of  Bank of America  stock, and $1.2 billion worth of holdings of  VeriSign  a provider of domain registry services, the report showed.

content.title: Berkshire Hathaway Bought Alphabet Shares in the Third Quarter. Here’s What It Sold.
content.summary: The filing, released on Friday, detailed the firm’s equity holdings of U.S.-listed securities as of Sept. 30.  Alphabet made up 1.6% of Berkshire’s portfolio by the end of September.  In the third quarter, Berkshire sold $10.6 billion worth of  Apple  shares, $1.9 billion worth of  Bank of America  stock, and $1.2 billion worth of holdings of  VeriSign  a provider of domain registry services, the report showed.
